video.title: HTML Tutorial - How to Make a Super Simple Website
video.description:
If you're an absolute beginner in web development, you can learn the basics of HTML here. This video covers setting up an HTML file, and the basic HTML tags and what they mean.

Download the website files to follow along with this tutorial:
https://coder-coder.com/cu-basic-website-html/

Read the blog post version here:
https://coder-coder.com/how-to-make-simple-website-html/

-

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.com

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://medium.freecodecamp.com

replies.author: swallowedinthesea11
replies.text:
Learn HTML and CSS together as they go hand-in-hand. There are CSS tutorials here. 

For HTML, focus a lot of time on learning div, forms, lists, and spans. 

For CSS, focus a lot of time on learning Grid and responsive design because there are billions of people around the world who browse on their phones. 

All the best!

topLevelComment.author: Lorenzo Robb
topLevelComment.text:
Note: I am not saying that HTML IS a programming language as determined by Computer Science, however…

While it doesn’t technically use logic in the way programming does, one thing I can say about it is that there is some sort of logic that goes into it. For example, I decided to do an experiment where I moved some nested div boxes around in a way where the boxes partially overlapped along with some text that was placed inside of each box. When I placed a div box with text that would normally be where the div boxes overlapped, that is where I found somewhat logic take place. When deciding where each div class needed to go, the placement in your code matters. The box that would normally have to be placed in the background of the other box was placed on top when listed first in the code. Therefore the text from the box that was supposed to be added first was also covered up. As obvious as this would seem, it still shows a form of logic where I would call it sequential logic compared to the logic actual programming languages use where the particular code is running the logic that was entered by the user to run the task by itself.

replies.author: swallowedinthesea11
replies.text: @Mustardpocket If you want to specialize creating in website builders, learning the old school won't be necessary. This is just my opinion. This is actually a big debate in the web development community between templates and old school.

replies.author: Mustardpocket
replies.text: @swallowedinthesea11 so it may not really be helpful to learn how to build a website, right? because for the majority of businesses (and individuals) they would be fine with a squarespace template and purchasing a domain name, it seems.

replies.author: swallowedinthesea11
replies.text:
Sometimes clients will want a website built from the ground-up because what they request is something services like Squarespace or Wordpress can't offer so you have to go old school. Even if SS offers great templates, sometimes creating your own to meet the custom needs of the clients will be more preferable. 

Big corporations like Amazon, McDonald's, Netflix, Walmart, etc. likely don't use website builders because they likely require everything from scratch from the front-end to the back-end like databases. For a small business or a ma and pa store, you could use templates. It all depends on your clients' needs. 

Also, it's pretty cool and fulfilling to have the skills to build a website by hand. I gained a boost in confidence building some clones like Steam and Windows XP which I'm currently working on.

replies.author: swallowedinthesea11
replies.text:
Whenever you're working on another project, it's best practice to put that index.html file into another folder. 

Let's say you're about to start working on a bakery website. It would look something like: 
1. In your Documents folder, make a new folder 'Emma's Bakery' 
2. Inside your 'Emma's Bakery' make a new file 'index.html' 

The same applies to CSS. It makes your HTML beautiful; you're the #1 Hollywood plastic surgeon. All websites in the world use CSS: 
1. In your folder 'Emma's Bakery' make a new folder 'css' 
2. Inside your css folder, make a new file 'style.css' 

The same applies to images: 
1. In your folder 'Emma's Bakery' make a new folder 'images' 
2. Inside your images folder, download and save all the images here that you want to use for your bakery. 

Repeat the above when you're working on a new project like 'Emma's Reaal Estate'

topLevelComment.author: Swahili SpicE
topLevelComment.text:
I’m sorry I don’t know your name but this has been the best, most straight forward and most  elementary html tutorial I have ever seen. This is how beginner should be taught. Most tutorials just say enter this here and enter that there and put this here and move that there, which doesn’t help make sense of things until you start encounter problems which force you to figure things out, not from knowledge but from trial and error. Trial and error is good but after some real technical knowledge is embedded already. 

I love the way you explain each element of html, the way you explained that ‘a’ stands for anchor and why the anchor reference is used for that tag makes it less likely for me to forget the tag for links because I can make sense of the letter ‘a’ to denote a link in the tag. I just love love love your work! Appreciate your efforts, I will be introducing your videos to my 12 year old son. You are exactly the kind of teacher that can create a new generation of master coders.

topLevelComment.text:
import random
import curses

s = curses.initscr()
curses.curs_set(0)
sh, sw = 5.getmaxyx()
w = curses.newwin(sh, sw, 0, 0)
w.keypad(1)
w.timeout(100)

snk_x = sw/4
snk_y = sh/2
snake = [
    [snk_y, snk_x],
    [snk_y, snk_x-1],
    [snk_y, snk_x-2]
]

food = [sh/2, sw/2]
w.addch(food[0]), food[1], curses.ACS_PI)

key = curses.KEY_RIGHT

while True:
    next_key = w.getch()
    key = key if next_key == -1 else next_key

    if snake[0][0] in [0, sh] or snake[0][1] in [0] in snake[1: ]:
        curses.endwin()
        quit()

    new_head = [snake[0][0], snake[0][1]]

    if key == curses.KEY_DOWN:
        new_head[0] += 1
    if key == curses.KEY_UP:
        new_head[0] -= 1
    if key == curses.KEY_LEFT:
        new_head[0] -= 1
    if key == curses.KEY_RIGHT:
        new_head[0] += 1

    snake.insert(0, new_head)

    if snake[0] == food:
        food = None
        while food is None:
            nf = [
                random.randint(1, sh-1),
                random.randint(1, sw-1)
            ]
            food = nf if nf not in snake else None
        w.addch(food)[0], food[1], curses.ACS_PI)
    else:
        tail = snake.pop()
        w.addch(tall[0], tail[1], ' ')

       w.addch(snake[0][0], snake[0][1], curses.ACS_CKBOARD)
   



                                                            Written by Sami

replies.author: Vega S. T.
replies.text:
You’ve probably figured out how to do this by now, as the comment is 2 months old. However, I will state what needs to be done for anyone else who owns a Mac and isn’t sure how to create a new html file. 

TextEdit can be found by typing in “TextEdit” in the ‘spotlight’ search magnifying glass found in the upper right hand corner of the screen or by simply going to “Applications” and searching for “TextEdit.”

Open “TextEdit” and do the following:

1. Set up file as plain text by going to “Format” in the menu bar and select ‘Make Plain Text.’ 

OR 

Go to “TextEdit” in the menu bar. Select ‘Preferences.’ In the ‘New Document’ tab found in the ‘Format’ section, check ‘Plain text.’ Then, in the ‘Options’ section, be sure ‘Smart quotes’ is NOT checked.

2. Finally,  In the ‘Open and Save’ tab in “Preferences”, be sure “Display HTML files as HTML code instead of formatted text” is checked.

I tried to make this as clear as possible. Hopefully, these steps can help someone. If I’ve made any errors somewhere, please feel free to correct them. Thanks!

topLevelComment.author: payskin
topLevelComment.text: Please don't teach/show bad practices for beginners! The tag's border attribute is deprecated sincs HTML 4.01 (almost 20 years now) and obsolete since HTML5. So it really *does not exist*. Those who learn HTML nowadays should not know about these attributes at all, let alone use it anywhere in their web pages. Either show the proper, valid way to put a border around an image (I understand you didn't want to get into CSS in this video), or don't show it at all. Similarly, in HTML5 doesn't have border, cellpadding and cellspacing attributes. These are all obsolete and not part of the standard.
